pros: Most supervisors on campus are very cognisant of your school responsibilities and give you a lot of flexibility.
cons: Not great pay per hour

pros: -Great people to work with -Work life balance -Flexibility -Like to promote from within -Great benefits
cons: -Extremely underpaid -Uncertainty about the future -Can only carry over a few days until October and then you lose any unused vacation time

job_title: Circulation Desk Assistant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Great community with a well thought out vision of the university.
cons: There is very little growth in terms of career aspirations.

pros: Good, excellent, very nice collègues and Administration
cons: None, to declare. The weather there was not good tho

pros: There is little traffic in Valparaiso, IN
cons: University facing enrollment problems. Very low pay compared to other universities

pros:
- minimal driving traffic in Valpo
- town has a nice downtown (plaza, ice rink in the winter)
- 20 minutes from the Dunes National Park beaches
cons:
- university in decline, so lots of layoffs and turnover as fiscal mismanagement and enrollment drops come home to roost
- many decades of under-paying people, so problems with salary compression and retention of faculty and staff
- low morale and long-term vision across campus, since faculty are either trying to save their programs or leave, but giving up much planning for intellectual or programmatic innovation for a long-haul
- increased workload on remaining staff as people leave

pros: Very flexible depending on the Professor in charge.
cons: None that I came accorss

job_title: Clinical Associate Professor in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Close to home Access to good activities on campus Free tuition for dependents
cons: Lots of turnover right now

review_title: Good work environment and wonderful colleagues, marred by turnover and administrative dysfunction
job_title: Assistant Professor (Arts & Humanities) in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Good people, decent facilities, eager students
cons: Lots of turmoil in the past few years including budget cuts, furloughs, layoffs. University doesn't pay enough to retain good staff which means everyone's jobs become more difficult.

pros: - friendly workplace and promotes growth
cons: - none great place to work

review_title: Come for the tuition remission, stay for the people
pros: Great culture and work family, working with students, tuition remission.
cons: No raises, tuition remission is great but classes are primarily in a traditional-student friendly format, which is difficult for working adults, especially those with a family.

pros: After Covid there are no benefits.
cons: There is a family running the police dept and if you go to Human Resources about them they retaliate by changing your shifts and making stuff up. Hostile and backstabbing. They are not happy with just firing you they want to ruin your reputation.

pros: Easy onboarding, very flexible with curriculum development
cons: Pay is egregiously low, also requires a commitment to "Lutheran values"

review_title: Great campus community with low pay
pros:
Great campus community
Enthusiastic music program
cons: Low pay (to the point where adjuncts and lecturers, who shoulder the highest responsibility for teaching, are eligible for social services)

pros: Good tuition remission for employees and dependents.
cons: Very little upward mobility for someone without a Ph.D.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: I was looking for a place on campus to work and was able to apply to work at the Christopher Center. I have been working there for over two years and I love it! It’s a perfect on-campus job.
cons: Some of my peers think the management can be a bit overbearing but I haven’t had that experience.

review_title: Working at Electrical Engineering department Valparaiso
pros:
Best community I ever worked in
Teaching focused
Everyone is very helpful, kind and encouraging, free of ego.
Lot of creative freedom - freedom to design courses, bring in new ideas, suggest and make changes.
Can manage lot of time to do independent research in summer.
No mental pressure.
cons: Even though there is lot of freedom in designing your own course, it still remains student centric. This could be one adjustment if your background is from research universities.

review_title: Not paid enough and Bad Management
pros: My co-workers were wonderful and the fast-paced environment was engaging.
cons: Shifts and ordering were incredibly mismanaged and led to a lot of unpaid overtime and staff were underpaid as is.

pros: Flexible work, intellectual stimulation, teaching.
cons: Pay too close to poverty line

job_title: IT Student Technician in Valparaiso, IN
pros:
-Flexible hours
-Friendly Team
-Great Learning Opportunities
cons:
-Limited to openings around class schedule
-Pay is capped at 10/hr after 3 years

job_title: Associate University Registrar in Valparaiso, IN
pros: I loved the community at Valpo. People are hardworking and love the students. I was able to be hone skills in many areas and had a lot of freedom to make improvements.
cons: Everyone who works for Valpo works very hard for minimal compensation. Most end up treating their position as a way to work and gain experience while getting a degree, and then they move on.

review_title: Toxic Environment at the Police Dept too much Nepotism
pros: The Insurance was expensive but good and the Retirement was good. Tuition remission for employee and family.
cons:
The University quit paying into our retirement and they increased what we have to pay into insurance.
The Police Dept is a toxic environment full of nepotism. It is a revolving door no one stays there for long. Since 2008 at least 50 employees have gone through the place. I blame nepotism and micromanagement.

pros: Working with student population is rewarding.
cons: The work schedule was challenging.

pros: The students. Valpo does an amazing job of recruiting and enrolling the best and brightest students from all over the world.
cons: Slow business decisions. No room for growth. Standard cons for working within higher education.

pros: fun, exciting, good, good, good
cons: not much pay, short hours, on campus

pros: Benefits were good and enjoyed coworkers
cons: Micro Management, Nepotism, Vindictive towards employees who don't agree with management. Not respected in Law Enforcement community due to poor leadership. High turn over rate.

review_title: Stagnant growth opportunities and low pay
pros: Great benefits including, health, dental, vision and educational.
cons: Due to declining enrollment and other financial constraints there was no opportunity for additional compensation and few growth opportunities. Lack of diversity in both faculty, staff and students.

review_title: Great students and colleagues but the Univeristy is financially unstable
pros: Great colleagues and students, work life balance is possible. Faculty and staff try to do their best by students and in general students get a good education here.
cons: Pay is extremely low, and recent actions/decisions have completely eroded faculty trust in the administration. Lots of professors and other employees are actively looking for other jobs because we no longer trust the admin and think there is a very good chance the University may shut its doors in a few years.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Loved working as a TA for STEM department. Professors are great and students passionate about learning
cons: If you do not like helping people then this is not for you.

review_title: One of the best positions on campus
pros: Great community and an flexible hours
cons: The pay does not meet the expectations of the job

pros: Good working environment; great people; close to home.
cons: Compensation on the low side.

pros: All around great people and place.
cons: Terrible pay and benefit program.

pros: They have great faculty here.
cons: Getting registered here for the graduate program was a difficult process.

pros: There are no pros to working here.
cons: University is financially unstable, old, run down and will be shutting its doors in no time at all.

review_title: And the loss of compensation continues....
pros: Tuition remission after a year
cons: Faculty and staff are not appreciated, insurance premiums keep going up, salary keeps going down, more and more administrators are hired.

job_title: Head Cross Country Coach in Valparaiso, IN
pros: working with good students and people
cons: low salary, low budget, poor infrastructure

pros: Tuition remission for yourself and your family. Good medical if you utilize OurHealth.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: There is a chill work environment
cons: You cannot work many hours

pros: A lot of time off with because it is a school.
cons: The pay is really low

pros: Great Mission, Faculty, Students, Staff
cons: Unstable positions, board doesn't communicate with faculty, limited opportunity for growth

pros: Good benefits and friendly staff.
cons: No room for advancement. Management poor on communication.

pros:
Good amount of hours during the week, flexible work times and availability to switch hours with other students in certain instances. There are many potential ways to gain leadership such as serving as an academic coach, lead help sessions for students, tutor one on one or in a group, and serve as an administrative assistant. The Center is specific to the engineering and math departments only.

Working as a Hesse Scholar is one of the best paying jobs on campus (scholarships and a stipend every semester)  

5 hours a week tutoring time, but you can add hours through different roles within the Center.
cons: The amount of students you tutor can vary depending on the night. Sometimes a difficult homework assignment or exam coming up will make several students attend a help session or come in during open tutoring hours.

pros: Great benefits, good people. I worked there for a long period of time and genuinely enjoyed everyone I worked with.
cons: Disarray. I was never sure where I fit in because my job was all over the board, plus there were others who were promoted and had an actual title, where I really did not. There is still a lot of nepotism and salaries compared to other local institutions are still extremely low. Don't expect to ever make a good salary working here. I left for that reason alone, they just don't pay well.

job_title: IT Student Worker in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Working in IT, I'm surrounded by a really great team or co-workers.  They, along with management, are really supportive.  Being a student, the pay is decent and the work schedule is flexible.  Management really takes out time to train the employees also.  I've learned so much in my time as an employee.
cons: The work pace at times can be erratic and unpredictable.  Some days it is incredibly slow, and others it is hectic.  There are also a good deal of very annoying people working in IT.  I also think that management should do more in the form of team-building to improve worker morale.

review_title: Fantastic experience working in Office of Information Technology
job_title: Instructional Technology Consultant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Projects are fun and exciting as it concerns all Students and Faculty members of which you are one. Colleagues were very friendly and accommodating of my schedule as a Student. Integrity and hard work are usually rewarded. You learn a lot from so many spheres of education.
cons: I really enjoyed my time and it was quite an eye opener so there's very little negativity working on campus. However, you have to bring your A game as Professors and Lecturers might be quite impatient when solutions are needed.

pros: The educational model of VU is a unique and effective synthesis of professional education, liberal arts, and faith; very dedicated and gifted faculty, good facilities.
cons: Compensation lags significantly behind national averages and peer institutions; this is improving, but it remains a downside. Solid benefits, particularly the tuition remission, but non-tenure track faculty and professional staff salaries are on the low end. Administrative staff structure is quite lean in many areas, which doesn't allow a lot of room for internal advancement.

pros: We have excellent 401k options, tuition reimbursement, vacation.  Most people on campus are genuinely nice people. The students are a wonderful bunch - intelligent and respectful. I also feel safe here.
cons: The pay is horrible. Administration is very political.  Not a lot of room for advancement in any department on campus you might work in.

review_title: Other employees are pleasant to work with, but they pay could be better.
pros: The overall atmosphere at VU is fantastic, and I enjoy working with all of the other employees.  It is nice to work in a small university atmosphere.
cons: For those of you that prefer a large university, Valpo is not the place for you.  Also, I personally feel that the pay could be better than what I currently receive.

review_title: Do not waste your time applying here
pros: Autonomy. But not enough people willing to engage in projects, so you have the autonomy to do nothing.
cons: Poor leadership (very common opinion). High turn over. Hard to attract outside hires. City and campus are small minded. Leaders do not have proper training, leaders do not resolve conflict (they just let things "go"), leaders are not leaders and should not have been appointed to positions of leadership. Low pay compared to sister institutions. Very unhealthy work environment. Racist, sexist, ageist, attitudes; recent state law discriminates against LGTB community.

pros: As an instructor, your colleagues trust you to teach the way that you want. Lecturers are given the same authority in the classrooms as anyone else.
cons: The faculty is not diverse at all. Even though the student body has a lot of diversity, the faculty is almost all white and straight. There is a lot of racism but much of it is coded into everyday language.

review_title: Great place to work, even if part-time
job_title: Lifeguard and Swim Instructor in Valparaiso, IN
pros: The work environment itself was quite comfortable and easy going, and my supervisors and coworkers were very helpful and understanding. The rest of the staff was diverse and fun to work with, ages 18-60 and all of them were respectful and hard working.
cons: The only complaint I have is the number of hours given to myself and others, I would have liked to be given the opportunity to work more.

review_title: Great launching point for future career
job_title: Interlibrary Loan Assistant in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Gained valuable experience while retaining the convenient hours and location on campus, worked personally with bosses as opposed to dealing with a chain of information.
cons: There is no reward for individual effort, all bonuses and raises are institutional so that my experience, time working, training are not important in terms of what I get paid. Only the specific type of job matters.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Great work environment, awesome colleagues who would help you with any thing you need when you start your career there, small class sizes and great benefit and insurance package.
cons: The salary is very low for someone who holds a PhD degree. The school is teaching based and you are not expected to conduct any research, still the load of the teaching can be overwhelming sometimes.

review_title: Good place to work in I.T.
job_title: Manager of Help Desk Services in Valparaiso, IN
pros:
The I.T. team is a good team of professionals who genuinely get along.
The management of I.T. is dedicated.
The overall University culture is good.
cons:
Not a lot in terms of career advancement opportunities within I.T.
All of Higher Education is suffering right now, so budgets are tight.
The culture (as in most Higher Education) is slow to change and it's no different in I.T.

pros: Meet students. clean dorms,restroom, off on holidays and 401k plan ,dental and eyes and health insurance.
cons: Some of the student get very messy, the work is harder to do after the students leave for the summer.but it do not bother me.  I love what I do.

job_title: Associate Director, Creative Services in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Beautiful campus, new buildings with more to come, great co-workers across whole campus, terrific benefits like the wellness health plan, lunch time exercise classes, free admission to sports and arts events.
cons: Departmental:  Ambiguous job expectations, favorable treatment for management team members, unrealistic work volume, questionable leadership

pros: Valparaiso University is the best place to work because it is an outstanding educational Private Lutheran University with a great group of  students, staff and faculty.
cons: Valparaiso University is the best place to work.  The only reason I am seeking employment elsewhere is so that I am have the opportunity to grow professionally in my field of interest.

job_title: Assistant Director of Creative Services in Valparaiso, IN
pros: Wonderful work environment, great on campus benefits like free admission to sporting events, fitness center, cafeteria. The campus is very beautiful and is in a nice area.
cons: The range of backgrounds makes working with certain partners very difficult. Managers set deadlines that are not possible and sometimes refuse to back up their employees.

review_title: Valuing your people has to be more than just words
pros: Employees are like a family and take care of each other. People rarely get fired. Tuition remission is a fantastic benefit.
cons: Top heavy; too many C-level administrators. Not enough resources to help people do their jobs or continue to develop professionally. Constant expectations of "do more with less."

-amazing bosses

review_title: Don't join as a Visiting Professor
pros: Friendly people. Teaching is a top concern.
cons: Do NOT join as a visiting  professor. There is a huge chance that you won't be considered you for a tenure-track position.  They tend to think that they are the best and only hires people from very good schools!

pros:
*Great people to work with
*Campus events that keep you involved in University
*Great leadership
cons: Some departments on campus are resistant to changes but with the right leadership and foresight, this can be cahnged.

pros: Flexibility, great people, awesome culture, hands off and really allowed you to find a voice. For the most part forward thinking and willing to be progressive.
cons: Occasionally slow to make progress, but generally willing to change things up.

pros: Good benefits like tuition remission or exchange along with good health benefits.
cons: Due to poor fiscal state, raises are rare so salaries stay flat.

pros: Everyone is as dedicated as I am, and I can get an education while simultaneously working a job that considers my complicated schedule.

review_title: Overall, I have greatly appreciated the supportive environment.

pros: Very mission-oriented and driven to create a great experience for all.
